data.title: Common letter
data.solution:
n = int(input())

for i in range(n):
    line = input().lower()
    line = "".join(filter(str.isalpha, line))

    most_common_letter = max(line, key=lambda c: line.count(c))

    print(most_common_letter)
data.statement:
Given [[n]] lines of text, print the most common English letter (a to z, regardless of the case) in each line.

There will never be a tie between two or more letters.

testCases.title: Long text
testCases.testIn:
1
CodinGame is a technology company editing an online platform for developers, allowing them to play with programming with increasingly difficult puzzles, to learn to code better with an online programming application supporting twenty-five programming languages, and to compete in multiplayer programming contests involving timed artificial intelligence, or code golf challenges.

testCases.title: Long text
testCases.testIn:
1
CodinGame also serves as a recruiting platform, allowing developers to get noticed by companies based on their performance on the contests.

data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read line:string(1000)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[n]] being the number of lines to analyse.
<<[[n]] next lines:>> A line of text [[line]].
data.outputDescription: [[n]] lines with the most common character in each line.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given n lines of text, print the most common English letter (a to z, regardless of the case) in each line.

There will never be a tie between two or more letters.
Input
Line 1: An integer n being the number of lines to analyse.
n next lines: A line of text line.
Output
n lines with the most common character in each line.
Constraints
0 < n < 100
0 < Length of line < 1000
Example
Input
1
oops
Output
o
